name: macOS Catalina 10.15.3, Security Update 2020-001 Mojave, Security Update 2020-001 High Sierra
available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, and macOS Catalina 10.15.2

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: an anonymous researcher working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Multiple issues in PHP
advisories.description: Multiple issues were addressed by updating to PHP version 7.3.11.

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Zhuo Liang of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Searching for and opening a file from an attacker controlled NFS mount may bypass Gatekeeper
advisories.description: This was addressed with additional checks by Gatekeeper on files mounted through a network share.

cves.credit: Jose Castro Almeida (@HackerOn2Wheels) and René Kroka (@rene_kroka)

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Jianjun Dai of Qihoo 360 Alpha Lab
Jianjun Dai of Qihoo 360 Alpha Lab
Jianjun Dai of Qihoo 360 Alpha Lab

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to leak memory
advisories.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Jianjun Dai of Qihoo 360 Alpha Lab

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to access restricted files
advisories.description: A validation issue existed in the handling of symlinks. This issue was addressed with improved validation of symlinks.

cves.credit: Csaba Fitzl (@theevilbit)

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: James Hutchins

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Encrypted data may be inappropriately accessed
advisories.description: An issue existed with Siri Suggestions access to encrypted data. The issue was fixed by limiting access to encrypted data.

cves.credit: Bob Gendler of the National Institute of Standards and Technology

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Viewing a maliciously crafted JPEG file may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Samuel Groß of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Samuel Groß of Google Project Zero
Samuel Groß of Google Project Zero
Samuel Groß of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Zhuo Liang of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Brandon Azad of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to gain elevated privileges
advisories.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management.

cves.credit: Xiaolong Bai and Min (Spark) Zheng of Alibaba Inc. and Luyi Xing of Indiana University Bloomington

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Loading a maliciously crafted racoon configuration file may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: An off by one issue existed in the handling of racoon configuration files. This issue was addressed through improved bounds checking.

cves.credit: @littlelailo

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to read restricted memory
advisories.description: A validation issue was addressed with improved input sanitization.

cves.credit: Brandon Azad of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to read restricted memory
advisories.description: A memory initialization issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Haakon Garseg Mørk of Cognite and Cim Stordal of Cognite

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges
advisories.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Brandon Azad of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to determine kernel memory layout
advisories.description: An access issue was addressed with improved memory management.

cves.credit: Brandon Azad of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Ned Williamson working with Google Project Zero
Corellium

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Processing maliciously crafted XML may lead to an unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A buffer overflow was addressed with improved size validation.

cves.credit: Ranier Vilela

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Processing a maliciously crafted string may lead to heap corruption
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Ian Beer of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to gain elevated privileges
advisories.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking.

cves.credit: Ian Beer of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to overwrite arbitrary files
advisories.description: A validation issue existed in the handling of symlinks. This issue was addressed with improved validation of symlinks.

cves.credit: Csaba Fitzl (@theevilbit)

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to break out of its sandbox
advisories.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions.

cves.credit: Jakob Rieck (@0xdead10cc) and Maximilian Blochberger of the Security in Distributed Systems Group of University of Hamburg

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: Certain configurations may allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code
advisories.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

cves.credit: Apple

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6
advisories.impact: A malicious application may be able to overwrite arbitrary files
advisories.description: An access issue was addressed with improved access restrictions.

cves.credit: Csaba Fitzl (@theevilbit)

advisories.available: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to read restricted memory
advisories.description: A validation issue was addressed with improved input sanitization.

cves.credit: s0ngsari of Theori and Lee of Seoul National University working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative

advisories.available: macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected system termination or corrupt kernel memory
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation.

cves.credit: Ian Beer of Google Project Zero

advisories.available: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.2
advisories.impact: An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved permissions logic.

cves.credit: Dayton Pidhirney (@_watbulb)
